website_summaries.verdict: Gamers and video hounds alike will thrill to the Samsung CHG70 27-Inch Curved Monitor's winning combination: its fine standard-definition and HDR image quality, wide color gamut, high refresh rate, and superior stand.
pros: Good HDR performance in videos and games alike
Good color quality and image sharpness

customer_reviews.title: Received defective, used monitor
customer_reviews.text: Received a resealed item. Monitor exhibited some buzzing/coil whine from the bottom left which got progressively louder as the response time was changed to the fastest setting. Decided wasn't worth keeping and sent back. Other than the defect, the colours were great (more vibrant than my IPS monitor) and there were no dead pixels in the unit I received and minimal/no backlight bleed. 1 star for both poor QA and for sending customers a returned unit when they purchased new.
customer_reviews.author: Singh

customer_reviews.title: The sweet spot.
customer_reviews.text: Six weeks in and I love this monitor, 32" seems to be the sweet spot for me, I'm able to see the whole screen without moving my head and it's big enough to handle the 2k resolution without making everything tiny on screen. Using an Nvidia card so freesync is turned off and speed is turned up to max 144hz, no issues of any sort to report.
customer_reviews.author: H Marnoch

customer_reviews.title: Third times the charm!
customer_reviews.text: After recieving the first monitor I was very excited to use it, however whenever the monitor was put in stand by it would not switch back on (I contacted Amazon and got a replacement next day!) The replacement came and worked fine for a few days and then started to make a buzzing noise once again I contacted Amazon who got a replacement out the next day... On my third now and it works perfectly for gaming and looking on the internet. This is my first curved monitor and its safe to say I love it! Would definitley recommend even considering the problems I had!
customer_reviews.author: Smoph

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, but bad Qc.
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of the c27hg70 versions of this monitor, my first one had a few stuck green pixels and moderate backlight bleed. Unfortunately both of these got worse over time. I requested a replacement and was very *****ed off when the replacement arrived and had clearly been used before, was missing a screw and the calibration report. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Slight issues, overall good.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this screen when my old one broke, as my first 144hz upgrade from 60hz. I can say once you go 144hz you can’t go back. Regardless, within the first week the screen had slight issues, half of the screen would appear white upon boot - fixed by a quick off and on. Never happened during usage though. The issue has since gone. I also dislike how the screen makes a very faint; buzzing noise when off. Not noticeable without complete silence. But considering it’s near my bed - I usually have to unplug it entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I've had
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 27" version, to replace an old AOC 24" 144 Hz TN panel. This is much better but you do need a better graphics card if you want to game in 1440p@144Hz. This monitor has FreeSync2 (GSync too if you have a new nvidia RTX card), HDR6 and is quite big. The stand is quite nice, albeit large and heavy; it can tilt in an direction and it's possible to change the height. It is a curved display, although I don't seem to be able to perceive any difference from my old display. This monitor is great for gaming and even has a nice joystick button to configure the panel settings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Curved and crisp
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor for gaming being capable of 144hz and has decent picture quality. Only complaint is that somehow over time the bottom right of the plastic on my monitor has managed to crack, its small but noticeable. It really bugs me but also im not a fan of the way you have to turn the monitor off after detecting no signal, should be done by a simple dedicated button. Still works to this day either way
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: Freesync2.0 Gsync compatible Qdot panel 60% of HDR
customer_reviews.text: Now when Nvidia supports freesync this monitor is a game-changer. I have only heard about this sharp representation of colors now in person I am glad to did that purchase. 600nits of brightness that is 400nits short of true HDR but for the price-tag it is nobrainer. This monitor flickers when you use enabled Freesyn on gsync enabled graphics at low fps most noticeably during loading screens when you are on single digit frame rate. Next I have to try some HDR games. I can't do it enough justice by describing colors, you are better of if you see it in person.
customer_reviews.author: Tukan

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted from it.
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between a full 4K monitor and one that supported HDR. I got the best of both here. My Xbox one X Is truly opened up whilst using this. The back side LED is gimmicky, and in truth I should have opted for the smaller size as the 32” is a beast. Overall though, a great monitor which is currently doing a brilliant job.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. Absolutely love it so far. I've had it for about 1 week now and it is very very nice. The stand was kinda tricky to set up, mostly because at the beggining I didn't have a screw driver XD, but after I got one, piece of cake. The only thing that I can say about the stand is that if you accidentally "collide" with the monitor, for example, with your hand, when moving around, it would wobble a bit, before damping out. Minor thing, not to worry. Other than that it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar J.

customer_reviews.title: Decent gaming monitor, don't expect too much.
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is passable, HDR is useless The monitor itself is huge, the stand takes to a huge amount of space. Some minor damage when received to the back cover, not enough to warrant a return as it's not something I'll be looking at., also one dead pixel.. Doubt I'll be buying anything from Amazon Warehouse again. As a freesync gaming monitor, it's decent enough, but image quality is not great.
customer_reviews.author: M L.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The best 1440p 144hz HDR monitor on the market, the only issue is that the 32" model flickers under lower luminosity and it has been pointed out by many reviewers, these things shouldn't happen since they're basically forcing you to use this monitor at maximum brightness at all times in order to avoid eye strain by flickering.
customer_reviews.author: Ar

customer_reviews.title: This is truely impressive and certainly worth pairing up with the high end AMD graphics card to get the very best from it if a keen gamer
customer_reviews.text: After significant research purchased this high quality Samsung monitor. As a keen gamer and photo editer I demand high standards for my screens. This is truely impressive and certainly worth pairing up with the high end AMD graphics card to get the very best from it if a keen gamer. It really looks a premium prduct with brushed metal, sweeping curved screen and the blue LED backlight. A must buy, it will be money very well spent!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Daniel C Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Really good 144hz gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased I’ve sent lots of monitors back because I’ve not liked them even £700 Asus Rog swift ones but not this one being 24 inch I sit quite close don’t buy this monitor unless you’v got at least a vega 56 or a minimum gtx 1070 ti because you will have issues the resolution and picture grows on you very quickly and it’s made me want to game more also I’m using the Nvidia G-Sync update which means you put the monitors FreeSync enhanced mode on and I’ve had no glitches or flickering at all got to be one of the best 24 inch 144hz monitor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor for about a month now and it has been a massive upgrade over my previous monitors. I went down from a dual screen setup to just a single and boy was it worth picking up the 32 over the 27 inch. Gaming has been as crisp as ever, media and videos look amazing in HD. The curved screen, though it can be seen as gimmicky, really does give a premium feel to it, regardless of what you are doing. Haven't had a single concern or worry so far, though I will mention it was jarring moving from my biggest monitor previously being 24in to a 32 in terms of sheer size when viewing at close proximity.
customer_reviews.author: Dion

customer_reviews.title: Dead/stuck pixels on 3 different monitors
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor replaced 3 times with stuck pink/purple pixels on screen before I gave up. Beautiful monitor if you can manage to get a defect free one. These go through a factory calabration and I am unaware how all the units I received passed quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Baz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: HDR is awful and doesn't work really... but despite that it is still an amazing monitor. the colours are good, the curve is nice and helps with immersion. The only negative point (apart from the awful HDR) is the stand is a massive turd. It takes up far too much space. (twice what it needs to)
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Broken and missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: The monitor I received didn't work and was missing all screws required to attach the mount/stand. I tried using two systems and had the same issues also used 4 different hdmi cables as well as 2 separate display port cables very unhappy with the product I received. Whether this is a quality issue with Samsung or with the seller I do not know. Refund has been requested.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great viewing experience on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I'm really really impressed with this monitor for what it is. Looks really nice at 144fps, blacks are deep and colours are rich. The screen quality is superb for such a fast monitor which impressed me. I have it well positioned in my office which gets almost no glare but the anti-glare is nice and is helped by the curved screen. I'm not like a pro gamer (or even particularly competitive) but I just like a pleasant viewing experience while I'm playing which this monitor seems really suited for. Would recommend/10
customer_reviews.author: Wouldz

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Was abit on the fence about buying this monitor for my xbox one x and ps4 pro but I'm so glad I did. The xbox one x works brilliant with it at 1440p 120hz whilst the ps4 uses hdr at 60hz. Both consoles work brilliant with this monitor. Also tried it with my 2080ti gpu and the free sync works well with it now that Nvidia allows free sync monitors. The only bad thing is the stand is massive!! If you have a shallow desk then take this into consideration and get a third party monitor stand.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxson XD

customer_reviews.title: First one was visually stunning but kept switching itself off ...
customer_reviews.text: First one was visually stunning but kept switching itself off despite being set not to. Second one had 5 separeat areas of dead pixels. Never seen a screen so badly affected by dead pixels. Both returned. Now using my old 27" Asus. Very very warey of a third purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Doughty

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Fault
customer_reviews.text: Slight light bleeding on the right hand of the display from new but only really noticeable on very plain solid background colours. I returned the monitor after it developed another fault where some images/colours were not displayed properly, even on the OSD. Restarting the monitor fixes this, but the issue reoccurs days/weeks later. Poor quality control?
customer_reviews.author: Curtis R

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor, crisp images, freesync + HDR. I bought this with my Xbox One X as I play The Division. Am eagerly awaiting a new enhancements patch which will make this even better than now!
customer_reviews.author: Bucko

customer_reviews.title: Monitor ROCKS, Delivery SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly one of a kind. I've had this monitor for about 2-3months. Picture quality is amazing and it supports HDR what more could i ask for. HOWEVER, be careful when purchasing this on as some delivery drivers are absolutely lazy and should be fired as they gave my product to a random stranger to which amazon believed was a neighbour of mine. Amazon wanted me to go and visit this house and check if they have it and of course no one answered. After hrs of complaining I finaly got a refund and ordered it off currys but decision I've ever made. BUT despite this this monitor is absolutely amazing couldn't have asked for anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Vibrancy on steroids
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit sceptical about getting this monitor because of the bad reviews relating to quality control. I must have lucked out because it's been fantastic every day. There are pre set modes you can set the monitor to, for example gaming etc. I like the curve, it adds some subtle magnetism to the gaming experience. It's a vivid display with really bright and saturated colors. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: fuzzy screen in parts
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad, no dead pixels, bright (QLED), fast and freesync. But, there are several places where the pixels look fuzzy. Like if you put a greasy thumb mark on the screen. But, I can live with it and it's better than the other monitors I have tried which all had much more annoying faults.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Very bright, great size, disappointing display.
customer_reviews.text: the stand is fantastic, the size is fantastic, the brightness is fantastic, what isn't fantastic is the very visible colour interlacing, i've already exchanged it for another one and it's the same if not worse on the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor, Freesync is absolutely game changing, essential frankly. No point getting a good gaming PC without Freesync/Gsync. Only thing is that the stand actually occupies quite a lot of desk space, more than I expected and more than my previous monitor. I recommend a different stand or desk/wall mount with gas arms.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: Highest Grade 1440p Monitor On The Market
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is the top of the pack in regards to premium 1440p monitors, without breaking the bank. Quantum dot integration with the 10 bit colour accuracy provides excellent colour accuracy, with pinnacle viewing angles. The 144hz refresh rate provides a high degree of fluidity, in combination with HDR provides a stunning quality to detail for videos and images. Unrivalled by any other competitor on the market, this is definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deco

customer_reviews.title: quality control issues or something else!?
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine until this happened. just watch the video then you can understand what really happened.
customer_reviews.author: MADGulliver

customer_reviews.title: Fuzzy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this panel because of the very good reviews, all i am going to say is stay well clear of Samsung gaming monitors, they have a sharpness setting so in game everything looks WAY more aliased than it should, want to turn that sharpness down? ok but it still will look bad and even worse from the blur that's introduced, i will never recommend a gaming monitor that has a sharpness setting ever, for TVs and watching movies its fine but never for games.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing screen, quality build, best bang for buck gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant screen, vivid colours, best value for money gaming monitor out there right now and definitely not a budget feel. 144hz is great for most games if you PC is fast enough and the curve is a perfect aperture Set up is okay, but controls in the back of the monitor are old fashioned, clunky and do not compliment the modern design or tech, needs to be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Tear

customer_reviews.title: Backlight bleed galore and previously opened...
customer_reviews.text: VA panels are meant for great contrast/black levels. This one is as bad as other reviews have said. All over the screen there is backlight bleed which really does nullify the reason for having this in the first place! Also this was sent to me as 'new' but it was VERY obvious that this was not the case. The monitor had been opened before and the previous owner was probably not happy with it for the same reasons I am not and then it eventually made it's way to me. Naughty naughty...
customer_reviews.author: H Shadow

customer_reviews.title: One of the best 1080p 144hz screens.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Image quality is excelent thanks to the high contrast VA panel, better than IPS in my opinion. Excelent black uniformity Fast pixel transitions for a VA, could use a little bit more pixel overdrive at 120/144hz, i wish samsung included a pixel overdrive setting. No motion color artifacts at all on my unit. Screen coating does a great job at reducing reflections without reducing image quality. Including a factory calibration report is a nice touch. Cons: White uniformity could be better, a bit warmer on bottom right side. Some vertical banding visible on some static colors (can see it the most on 25% gray), not really that noticeable with my usage.
customer_reviews.author: askan7

customer_reviews.title: It's absolutely perfect with overwatch
customer_reviews.text: Had this monitor for 2 months now and really enjoying it. Developed a dead pixel after 2 weeks but most 144hz monitors will develop a dead pixel at some point. It's a lottery with 144hz screens. I still give this 5/5 though. It's absolutely perfect with overwatch. Vibrant colours yet it's running at 144!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor
customer_reviews.text: I have this paired with the Xbox one X so it handles 4K gaming really well. However have only tried 144Hz once when my friend has plugged his pc into it. Still great. Due to this being my first monitor I really love it but all the settings are great and another monitor you may want to look at is the Aorus or Asus Rog lines
customer_reviews.author: Welshninja

customer_reviews.title: Great 144 Panel
customer_reviews.text: Not much to fault with this. Colours on VA panels are great, viewing angle is great, blacks are great. Only real issue is that the curve is a bit pointless at this size and makes it feel a bit delicate. Interface is so much better than on standard monitors too.
customer_reviews.author: Nyarlith

customer_reviews.title: A god monitor but a bunch of dead pixels so bad QC
customer_reviews.text: It's a good monitor, looks great, but came with a bunch of dead pixels. Trying to get a replacement has also been a huge hassle. The monitor also seems to struggle when opening fullscreen programmes as it switches itself from HDR mode to non-HDR mode a bunch of times, so alt-tabbing out of games is not ideal. Other than that works okay, looks pretty good although blacks are a bit uneven.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Meehan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY TO USE FREESYNC IT CAUSES SEVERE FLICKERING
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming without free sync. With you will get severe flickering. Avoid if sensitive to epilepsy. My review was removed so clearly they are trying to disassociate from this issue as they passed the book of responsibility (surprise surprise) and blamed another party just as AMD did.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Most gorgeous screen I've ever used. Only wished my computer could do 144fps all the time on ultra settings.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for a great price
customer_reviews.text: 144hz, 1ms, curved - I've gamed since the late 90's and this monitor is by far the best I've ever had. The refresh rate has helped me up my game (forgive my pun), and the colour depth really makes a noticeable impact when gaming, watching videos, or just in general use. Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Comes with EU Plug
customer_reviews.text: Ships from Italy and so comes with a two pin EU plug. Have not been able to test the display otherwise yet - will update when I can.
customer_reviews.author: raf802

customer_reviews.title: Great looking monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. Everything runs so smooth with the 144hz display. Build quality is also good. Monitor can slide up and down on bracket so can for to where the user wants it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: You sure you want 2k???
customer_reviews.text: Its ok, but the 2K wastes a hell of a lot of processing power. W/ very little picture difference. For reference i have a i5 and a 1060ti
customer_reviews.author: morgan p.

customer_reviews.title: Great colour, grainy image though.
customer_reviews.text: The main thing that put me off was the screen quality. It looks bitty, grainy?. Everything else was fine for the price. VA was lovely but couldn't get past the grainy image Delivery was great, packaging wasn't so good but adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Gooders

customer_reviews.title: The backlight bleed.. IS INSANE. Not worth the price at all.
customer_reviews.text: The backlight bleed on this monitor is just insane. Dark scenes within movies/games just have a bright smudge all over them. The pricepoint on this monitor is just outrageous for the sort of quality you actually get. The 144hz is nice, but this can be achieved with a £150 Monitor. The resolution and 1ms response time isn't justified with the poor panel quality. £260 monitor at most, nevermind the £460 I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Appalling response time
customer_reviews.text: They advertise a 1ms response time, however that's the minimum. If you look into it further the average response time is 11ms which when considering this is a 144hz monitor (6.6ms per frame) that's pretty bad. Your mouse will drag all over the screen and you would get a LOT of motion blur in games. I do not recommend this as a gaming monitor at this price.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: 50/50 monitor, I'm not like him. Couple dead pixels on him. Flickering grey color. So I'm returned him back.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mazutis

customer_reviews.title: Colors are dope
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so colors are really amazing. Cant compare with other non qled screens, they look aweful. But the backlight image ghosting looks really annoying..can be seen only in gray/black images or videos
customer_reviews.author: Stefanos

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Delicate Display
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the monitor for nearly 2 months now, but as I was re-arranging my desk, I accidentally hit my elbow against the monitor lightly. However, this caused the screen to crack and the central portion of the monitor to stop functioning. I would not recommend this device considering the poor build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fast delivery, on reluctantly returning postage payed by retailer 10/10
customer_reviews.text: amazing value fantastic screen incredibly bright and colours just pop, response time are outstanding . sadly the screen a little to big for my available space.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Grumble

customer_reviews.title: Great for ps4 pro and xbox one x
customer_reviews.text: Using this with ps4 pro. Looks so much better than my tn panel which will be going back. Ps4 upscales from 1440p to 4k so well you can't tell the difference. Plus hdr looks beautiful. Can't wait for the Xbox one x Now!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it. Beautiful picture
customer_reviews.text: Took me ages to choose the correct screen but this really is a thing of beauty. Highly recommend it. Beautiful picture. Do note the stand is pretty large so will take up a lot of space but this can be changed easily enough but I do love that its height adjustable
customer_reviews.author: Jake P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Xbox One X
customer_reviews.text: Picture is amazing, input lag is very low and the monitor is compatible with Xboxs 120hrz mode. The HDR on the monitor is poor, but this is expected. Monitor is a must buy for someone who likes competitive games on Xbox, and the monitor will be great if you choose to move to PC also. 5 star!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming, movies and work
customer_reviews.text: Picture is amazing, especially the HDR setting. Great true blacks and vibrant colours. Definitely recommend. However, have noticed a dead pixel in the image. Only noticeable when the area of that screen is black (the pixel itself shines a whiteish/ green tint) but nothing seems to be getting worse.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I ran this monitor for just over 2 months before it started growing dead pixels, it then just started to flicker and black screen where it is unusable no matter what settings you use. This monitor is not worth the time or money.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Stunning monitor, reaction time is great I notice no input lag or ghosting, menu and joystick layout is the easiest I’ve had with a monitor
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good 1080p curved monitor for the price. I would say it does improve your gaming although don't expect to get 144hz from the PS4 the most you can get is 120hz I think but that's down to the PS4 not the monitor. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing motor great hdr
customer_reviews.text: Amazing motor great hdr, curved screen would be more effective at larger sizes though, sharp clear and beautiful otherwise.

customer_reviews.text: The monitor is one of the best 144hz 1ms out there with great colours and design. The only issue I have with the monitor is that when I change the response time to fastest which is the 1ms eventually, I can hear it making noises (like is not a typical silent monitor).

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixel woe
customer_reviews.text: Had to return my first one when the headphone port became faulty and dead pixels appeared after only a month. Now my second one has dead pixels as well and makes creaking noises when in standby. I would love this monitor if they actually worked properly.

customer_reviews.text: This monitor is just amazing, smooth display with an immersive curve. Use on display port to maximize the refresh rate to 144hz!!! Fantastic monitor, couldn't be happier

customer_reviews.text: Wonderful monitor Very good colours and response time is good for VA Colour is probably best in class Only con would be the stand is a little too big for my liking

customer_reviews.title: My New Secondary Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Good for casual games, movies, and as a secondary monitor if you dislike IPS monitors. Colors look noticeably better than my relatively new TN gaming monitor Acer XB241H but they need getting used to. The stand is sturdy but it takes a lot of space.

customer_reviews.text: Overall very good monitor, but if you like crisl and noce text - this is not a monitor for you.

customer_reviews.title: Not any better than an average TN panel
customer_reviews.text: Color saturation and viewing angles are very weak. Black level isn't great either. Picture settings and color calibration don't substantially improve picture quality. The curvature helps alleviate poor horizontal viewing angles a bit, but vertical angles remain problematic. Picture has noticeably lower contrast near top and bottom edges of the screen. Currently HDR is not properly supported by Windows 10, and there are very few games with HDR support. The only good thing about it is that 120Hz mode works. While Nvidia cards can't use freesync, cards powerful enough to consistently render 120fps can take advantage of it.
